ques:
You have an image `my-app:latest`. You want to tag it as `v1.0` before pushing.

Write the command.
explanation: **`docker tag`** creates a new alias for an existing image ID, allowing you to refer to it by a different name or version.

title: Image Layers ğŸ°
ques: Are Docker image layers read-only or read-write?
explanation: Docker images are built from a series of **read-only** layers. When you run a container, a thin read-write layer is added on top.

title: Pushing to Registry â˜ï¸
ques:
You have tagged your image as `username/my-app:v1`. Now you want to upload it to Docker Hub.

Write the command.
explanation: **`docker push`** uploads your local image to the specified registry (like Docker Hub).

title: Multi-Stage Builds ğŸš€
ques:
You want to keep your final image small by copying only the compiled binary from a build stage.

Which Dockerfile instruction allows you to copy files from another stage?
explanation: **`COPY --from=<stage>`** allows you to copy artifacts from a previous build stage, discarding the build tools and intermediate files.

title: Dangling Images ğŸ‘»
ques: What is the term for images that have no tag and are not referenced by any container (often shown as `<none>:<none>`)?
explanation: **Dangling images** are layers that have no relationship to any tagged images and are usually safe to remove to free up space.
